body: It looks like there is a task using Vert.x that is executed after Vert.x being shutdown. Do you know what is this task?

I do not. The repropducer was made by using [quarkus get started](https://quarkus.io/get-started/), selecting the grpc and kafka streams extension, and adding the code and configuration from https://quarkus.io/guides/kafka-streams#creating-the-aggregator-maven-project.

If we change `quarkus.grpc.server.use-separate-server` to false (default is true) then the issue does not happen.

It's gRPC trying to enqueue something at shutdown

```
at io.vertx.grpc.VertxServer$ActualServer.lambda$stop$7(VertxServer.java:139)
```

Thanks! 

I wonder how Kafka streams is impacting the shutdown of gRPC. @ozangunalp /  @alesj any idea?
@pcasaes does this also happen with older Quarkus versions?

Testing...

3.13.3 -> issue present
3.12.1 -> issue present
3.11.1 -> issue present
3.10.1 -> issue present
3.9.1 -> issue present
3.8.1 -> issue present

Through debugging I was able to confirm that `KafkaStreamsProducer` has an `EnhancedQueueExecutor` injected into it

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/3.14.3/extensions/kafka-streams/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/kafka/streams/runtime/KafkaStreamsProducer.java#L75

Which it then shuts down on stop:
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/3.14.3/extensions/kafka-streams/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/kafka/streams/runtime/KafkaStreamsProducer.java#L168

The instance of this executor is the very one used by vertx (which grpc tries to use on stop).
